results.title: Mark Twain's America
results.creator_credit: Donald B. Hyatt and National Broadcasting Company
results.brief_description: A record of Mark Twain’s America, using contemporary engravings and photographs. Mark Twain as the storyteller describes the atmosphere as he saw American history during his lifetime. The narration is taken in part from the writings of Twain and his contemporaries. Originally televised in the series “Project 20”, this is one of the longest films yet made based entirely on still photographs and prints. Credits include script by Richard Hanser, music by Robert Russell Bennett, narrated by Howard Lindsay and edited by Silvio D’Alisera.

results.title: Mark Tobey
results.brief_description: An experiment toward the interpretation of a personal vision. Opens with an unusual sequence in which various people comment on Tobey’s abstract paintings on exhibition. The artist is shown in his studio and against the background of the city of Seattle. A poetic voice-over narration accompanies various images suggesting the personal vision of the artist, so that this film emphasises the inner rather than the outer life of the artist. Photographed by William Heick, with narration by Robert Gardner and Mark Tobey.

results.title: Marius and Jeanette
results.creator_credit: Robert Guediguian, Gilles Sandoz, Agat Films, Cie and La Sept Cinema
results.brief_description: Jeanette (Ariane Ascaride) is a middle-aged cashier, struggling on a low wage in the new global economy and trying to raise her two children as best she can. Marius (Gerrard Meylan) is a security guard who falls in love with the fiery Jeanette but is uncertain if the traumas of his past will ruin the chance for happiness between them. Filmed in the industrial city of Marseilles, this deeply humanistic film reinstates the provincial working class as the subject of French cinema, examining the condition of working people in the post-Soviet era of globalisation and economic rationalism. Retreating from the radical aesthetics of the post-68 generation, “Marius and Jeannette” instead takes its inspiration from the humanist realist traditions of early French cinema and the social realism associated with the English cinema of Ken Loach and Mark Leigh. Family, commitment and trust are celebrated in this film, as is tolerance, and political and communal responsibility. The acting of Ascaride and Meylan is first rate, as it is with the excellent supporting cast. Filmed in the proletariat sections of the city, this film is also a loving tribute to the history of struggle in Marseilles. In the age of ironic detachment or extravagant violence, “Marius and Jeannette” is a fin-de-siecle film that argues for engagement and for tenderness. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Marionettes: construction and manipulation
results.brief_description: A detailed description of the construction of Bobo, a glove puppet, at the Universal School of Handicraft Marionette Theatre. When Bobo is finished and dressed, and his controls for manipulation attached, Mrs. Goedeler demonstrates how Bobo is manipulated. He is seen in action with a trained seal.

results.title: Marine sand animals
results.brief_description: A simple ecological study of common animals whose structure and habits enable them to live in the sand of the sea-shore or the sea-bed. The following animals are seen: Astropecten burrowing and turning over; the heart-urchin burrowing (time-lapse under-water cinematography); the weever fish; the plaice; the masked crab burrowing; various worms either actively burrowing or living in tubes and collecting their food. The whole series is related to the fall and rise of the tide.

results.title: Marine erosion processes: Cliffed coasts
results.brief_description: Illustrates the major processes at work in shaping cliffs, using a wide variety of examples from along the South Coast of NSW and several animated diagrams. Covers wave attack, subaerial weathering; type and structure of rock; the topography of the coastal margin; and the effects of past climate and changing levels of land and sea.

results.title: Marine animals and their foods
results.brief_description: The inter-relation of marine animals and their surroundings is demonstrated by showing various sea animals and the five general types of foods on which they depend. Marine animals illustrated include the sea anemone, the sea urchin, the barnacle, and the octopus. Types of foods include diatoms, plankton, debris, detritus, seaweed, and other animals. Mentions is made of the specific adaptations of marine animals for obtaining one or more of the main types of food.

results.title: Marilyn Monroe: beyond the legend
results.brief_description: This documentary narrated by Richard Widmark, is a tribute to the legendary actress. Numerous film clips range from her earliest appearances in “Dangerous Years” and “All About Eve”, to her triumphant performance in “Bus Stop” and “The Misfits”. The film also features a wealth of rare archival and newsreel footage, as well as in depth interviews with colleagues and friends.
